Uses of Class
edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers.GeometricObject

    • Uses of GeometricObject in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers

      Subclasses of GeometricObject in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  Ball
      The Ball class is based on a generic GeometricObject and has agreed to implement the Colorable and Drawable interfaces so that code using the Ball class can check if it's an instance of those interfaces and be sure that those methods are defined.
      class  ConsumingBall
      A ConsumingBall is a Ball that is always accelerating in the direction of the closest ball.
      class  EvadingBall
      An EvadignBall is a Ball that is always trying to move in the direction away from the nearest ball to it.
      class  ExpandableBall
      An ExpandableBall is a ball that implements the Expandable interface.
      class  IntelligentBall
      An intelligent ball is a Ball that: Tries to accelerate towards smaller balls that are near it (to consume them) Tries to accelerate away from larger balls that are near it (to evade them) TODO: All Intelligent balls should be blue by default TODO: Write this entire class.
      Methods in edu.nyu.cs.cs101.consumers that return GeometricObject 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static GeometricObject GeometricObject.getClosest(GeometricObject object, java.util.ArrayList<GeometricObject> objects)
      Finds the ball closest to ball.

      Calculates the distance between two particles.

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      (package private) void EvadingBall.accelerate(java.util.ArrayList<GeometricObject> objects)
      Always accelerates way from the closest ball.
      (package private) void ConsumingBall.accelerate(java.util.ArrayList<GeometricObject> objects)
      Consuming balls always accelerate towards the closest ball.
